name: chicagotribune
text: We should be able to find new homes for our old artifacts from a misbegotten time without unlawfully destroying property, writes columnist @cptime. https://t.co/fUExVEZ1Lb

name: chicagotribune
text: Commentary: It’s been a bad year for gun violence in Chicago, but every day is an opportunity to push for change. We need to reach more and more young men, give them hope and help them transform their lives, writes Arne Duncan. https://t.co/t3RC50Ry1j

name: chicagotribune
text: A Black rookie Chicago cop says he’s leaving the police union over criticism of kneeling officers. "The FOP has not been welcoming to folks like me," he said. https://t.co/wwd1bPzsDV

name: chicagotribune
text: A home security video captured close-up images of a gunman killing his companion at point-blank range in Rogers Park. https://t.co/x5OSxyD3QG

text: Commentary: The ship full of excuses for Christopher Columbus has sailed, writes Bob Chiarito. https://t.co/Y8Q33yEEA6

text: As Chicago moves into another phase of reopening, two federally endangered shorebirds are entering their own new phase of trying to save their species. https://t.co/v9CmDUGBZm
